In vivo data from the AMAZES study, the largest clinical trial of a long‐term macrolide in airways disease, showed a striking 40% reduction in asthma exacerbations with AZM.
29 The mechanism is unknown, and would be consistent with an anti‐viral effect, although metagenomic analyses suggest an antibacterial effect reducing Haemophilus influenzae
33 ,
34 may be the predominant mechanism. The effect on viruses may relate to H. influenzae upregulation of ICAM‐1, a major receptor for both Haemophilus and rhinovirus (RV).
